website_summaries.verdict: This model comes with a few concerns, but it is still worth a look for anyone who needs a hot plate with two burners.
pros: Price is budget-friendly for a two-burner model
Combination of stainless steel and smooth burner surfaces for a modern look
cons: Some pots and pans slide around on the smooth surface

customer_reviews.title: Power Light Issue
customer_reviews.text: The power light is on only when the burner is heating. This could be dangerous in the following example; 1) turn on to hi and leave it hi for a few minutes, 2) turn down to medium (power light turns off) and you finish cooking. 3) Forget to turn knob to off and walk away. In the previous scenario the burner is at the medium setting but the power light is off when you were done cooking. The light will eventually come on again and the burner will maintain medium heat but you might think it is off as you have already finished cooking and walked away.

Size:Double PlateShorter Pre-Heating. Faster Cooking Time. 

Everything seems to be instant in this modern-day era, and we disdain the thought of having to wait a couple of minutes before we get what we want: We want same-day delivery from merchants. We want to stream movies and TV series the moment they're out. We want our download speeds faster. At Ovente, we do not understate the value of speed to meet your demand for everything fast! 

Discover how fast it is boil a full pot of stew and how easy it is for heavy and thick pans to heat up with the help of our 1500W infrared ceramic glass double-plate burner. It uses a sophisticated infrared technology to heat food evenly without cold or hot spots. Plus, it keeps the heat constant according to your desired temperature. 

Compatible to All Cook Wares 
The burner’s crystallite ceramic glass works with all cookware, whether they’re glass, ceramic, or stainless. However, use of flat cookware that has sizes as close to the plate sizes of the burner (7”) is recommended. 


How to Use the Infrared Ceramic Glass Double Plate Burner 
1. Plug it in. 
2. Place cookware of your choice on the glass surface. 
3. Turn the knob to your desired heat level. 
4. When finished cooking, unplug the cooktop and wait for it to cool down (minimum of 15 min). 
5. Wipe it clean with a damp cloth. 

Warning: Never use petrol products, harsh/abrasive cloths, or soap to clean your cooktop burner. These might scratch the surface or damage the unit. 

Key Features: 
High-quality crystallite ceramic glass 
Two 7” Cooking plates 750W (left plate) + 750W (right plate)
Fire-resistant metal housing 
With temperature knob 
Non-slip rubber feet 
Indicator light

CLASSY AND PORTABLE – Its flat stainless steel housing and sleek crystallite ceramic glass tops make this burner look great on any countertop. Plus it is slim and light (5.1 lbs) making it perfect for small studios kitchenettes and camping trips.
